page.title: 01EXETER CATHEDRAL
page.content: The Norman Cathedral is a religious and tourist centre. Three services are held daily. Approximately 300 000 people visit the Cathedral every year. Tourists are attracted by the architecture, atmosphere and organ. 28% of the tourists are foreign (mostly American). There are 4 vergers and one cleaner working full time, one part time cleaner, 5 masons, 4 office staff, an organist, 3 canons and the Dean. It costs Â£4000 a week to run the Cathedral and Â£100 000 a year to maintain the 10 year restoration programme. The Cathedral Bookshop was started by the head verger and sells souveniers, books, postcards etc. The Cathedral is also used for concerts, meetings and lectures.
